alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 2:35PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following counties, Rio Arriba and Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, and a trained weather spotter northwest of Jemez Springs reported 2.20 inches of rainfall. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen over much of the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Rio Arriba and North Central Sandoval Counties - This includes the following recreation areas... Clear Creek Campground and Rio Las Vacas Campground.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
